question: Based on our knowledge of the ATAC-seq insert distributions, which of the following would be an appropriate insert size range to obtain mononucleosomal fragments?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Remember that nucleosomes include 145 bp of DNA wrapped around histones. Fragments less than this size likely correspond to nucleosome free regions.

Close, but while nucleosomes consist of 145 bp of DNA, the insertion by Tn5 a short distance from nucleosomes provides a range of insert values starting at 145 and extending further. Choose the appropriate size range using the graph shown at the start of this module.
Correct. While nucleosomes consist of 145 bp of DNA, the insertion by Tn5 provides a slightly larger size range. Using the above graph, we can pick the appropriate range.
Nucleosomes consist of 145 bp of DNA, thefore 300-500 bp insert sizes typically correspond to di-nucleosomes.
